intro: Wahlenbergia subaphylla subsp. thesioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of delicate, sky-blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal areas. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is well adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections.
